data.title: Discover the Adirondacks in New York State
data.meta_description: The 6-million-acre Adirondack Park was established by the New York State Legislature in 1892, and has evolved in to a patchwork of public and private lands. Learn more about this unique area here.
data.text:
Navigate Through the Adirondacks: Site Map

Lodging in the Adirondacks

From this page above, you can choose from all forms of accommodations

Cabins & Cottages - Cozy cabins and cottages nuzzled throughout the Adirondack Mountain Region.

Hotels, Motels & Resorts in the Adirondacks - Visit the Adirondacks in style!

Camping - In the Adirondacks, outside is the place to be! Check out the many campgrounds that grace the Adirondack Park.

Bed and Breakfasts / Inns - Love waking up to the smell of coffee and breakfast even when you're not at home? Try one of our quaint Adirondack Inns.

Pet Friendly Lodging - Think Fido would enjoy the Adirondacks? Choose from many pet friendly accommodations in the Adirondack Mountains

Vacation Rentals

All Lodging

Adirondack Lodging Specials - Hot deals!

Things To Do in the Adirondacks

The Adirondacks offers a plethora of attractions and activities to choose from!

Attractions

Golf & Miniature Golf - Golfing is a great way to enjoy the great outdoors!

Shopping - Outlet Malls, Quaint Shops, Malls ... The Adirondacks has it all!

Skiing in the Adirondacks - Love snow? There's no place like the Adirondacks for winter fun!

Museums - The Adirondacks are also full of history! Visit a museum during your stay.

Summer Camps - Find a summer camp in the Adirondacks

Fishing & Hunting

Canoes & Kayaking - With all the lakes in the Adirondacks, canoeing and kayaking is a favorite.

Fun for Kids - Bring the kids! There is fun for the whole family in Upstate New York.

Boat Rentals & Marinas

Balloon Rides - See the Adirondacks from above! Gorgeous views and unforgettable memories!

Whitewater Rafting

Snowmobiling - Snowmobiling is just another way to enjoy the outdoors during the winter months!

Bus Tours

Coupons - Save on Adirondack Attractions!

Full List of Things to Do

Restaurants

You will eat well during your visit to the Adirondacks! Use these pages to get dining ideas.

Dining - What's your pleasure? Adirondack.net lists restaurants for all tastes!

Bars & Clubs - Enjoy nightlife? Find bars and clubs in the Adirondacks.

Caterers

Events Calendar

So much to do ... so little time!

Living in the Adirondacks

Business Services

Jobs - Find a job!

Seniors & Healthcare

Real Estate

Homes, Condos & Land - Find what's for sale, search for your dream dwelling!

Commercial - Find business locations available in the North Country!

Real Estate Firms - Get personalized guidance in your quest to fulfil your desire to purchase property.

Apartments - Looking to find an apartment in the Adirondacks,

Mortgages & Loans

Builders & New Construction

Modular Homes

Movers & Storage

Property Management

Real Estate Law

Retirement Housing - There are many reasons to retire in the Adirondacks!

Renovations

Home & Garden

Full list from Real Estate Category

Meetings

What better place to hold a meeting, conference or convention than in the Adirondacks!

Meeting Venues - Find the perfect venue to host your event.

Entertainers - Keep your special event interesting with entertainment!

Caterers

Event Planners

Limos - Arrive in style to your meeting, convention or wedding!

Photographers & Videographers - Create a video or photo slide show for your meeting or OF your meeting!

Meeting Services

All Meeting Category Info

About the Region

Adirondack Park

Sacandaga Lake - The Great Sacandaga Lake is tucked away in the foothills of the Adk Mountains

Cranberry Lake - Cranberry Lake is one of the largest Adirondack Lakes!

Adirondack History

Weather - Check the weather before you pack for your trip!

Directions

Guides

Winter - Winter does not lack for activities in the Adk Mountains!

Hiking - There is no place like the Adirondacks for hiking! See kid friendly hiking options.

Downhill Skiing

Cross Country Skiing - View Cross Country Skiing and Snowshoeing Trails

Ausable Valley

Summer Camps

Adirondack Lakes

Biking Information

Olympic Venues

Dog Sledding

Whitewater Rafting

Adirondack Towns

Adirondack - A quiet, sleepy town on the shores of Schroon Lake

Argyle

Au Sable Forks

Beekmantown - On Lake Champlain near the US-Canadian border.

Benson

Big Moose

Blue Mountain Lake - Visit the famous Adirondack Museum during your stay to Blue Mountain Lake!

Bolton Landing - Just 10 miles north of Lake George!

Brant Lake

Cambridge

Canton - A college town in northwestern NY

Carthage - Carthage, New York is located along the "Mighty Black River"

Caroga Lake

Chateaugay

Chestertown - Watersports abound on Loon Lake, Schroon River and the Hudson!

Crown Point

Diamond Point - Southern Adirondack region and directly on Lake George!

Dresden

Eagle Bay - Relax and enjoy the sights of Eagle Bay, New York.

Easton

Elizabethtown - Located at the foot of Hurricane Mountain, with the Boquet River streaming through town.

Fort Ann

Fort Edward

Glens Falls - The home of Mannix Marketing, Inc! America's "Hometown" is Glens Falls, NY!

Granville

Greenwich

Hadley - Luzerne

Hague - A peaceful village on Northern Lake George

Hampton - A tiny town on the border of Vermont!

Hartford - 60% farmland, 30% farmers

Hebron - You'll find a quiet, simple life in Hebron, NY.

High Peaks

Hudson Falls / Kingsbury - Essentially a rural town, Kingsbury is a pleasant place to live.

Indian Lake

Jackson - Covered bridges, rolling hills, wildlife and scenic roads ... all in Jackson, New York.

Inlet

Jay - Jay, NY has a central location from which you can visit many Adirondack towns!

Johnsburg

Keene - Mt. Marcy, the highest point in the Adirondacks, makes its home in Keene, NY.

Keene Valley - The "Home of the High Peaks"!

Lake Champlain

Lake George - An adventurers' haven! For more info, visit Lake George . com.

Lake Luzerne

Lake Placid / Whiteface Mountain - The perfect town for a winter getaway!

Long Lake

Malone - Spend the day on the slopes of Titus Mountain or ice fishing on Lake Titus - both located in Malone, NY!

Mayfield

Minerva - A nature lover's paradise!

Newcomb

North Creek / Gore Mountain - The Gore Mountain Region is a winter wonderland!

North Hudson

North River

Northville - A charming Adirondack village.

Old Forge - Surrounded on all sides by lakes! Enjoy the Adirondack Scenic Railroad and Old Forge Lake Cruises.

Osceola

Paul Smiths

Peru

Plattsburgh

Potsdam - Activities on the River are a favorite pastime for folks in this Adirondack town!

Putnam

Queensbury - Today Queensbury is noted for its tourism trade.

Ray Brook

Rouses Point - A quiet village nestled on the US Canadian border.

Salem - Salem's major agricultural enterprises are dairy and potato farming.

Saranac Lake

Schroon Lake

Schuyler Falls

Speculator - This village has only 400 townspeople!

Stony Creek

Stratford

St. Regis Falls

Thendara

Ticonderoga - Ticonderoga is a historic town!

Tupper Lake - Nicknames "The Crossroads of the Adirondacks"

Warrensburg

Westport - A quiet community filled with traditional activities and events along the shores of Lake Champlain.

White Creek

Whitehall - Whitehall is located on Lake Champlain and on the NY / Vermont border.

Willsboro - A quaint town on Lake Champlain. For a quiet summer getaway, consider Willsboro, NY!

Wilmington

Adirondack Chairs

Come on, you know we have to promote these Adirondack inspired, comfortable chairs!

Hiking

We have all the info you need to make your hiking trip a success! Try these trails!

Black Mountain - See photos of Black Mountain

Buck Mountain - A pleasant, moderate, 3 mile trail.

Cat Mountain - Experience a variety of terrains and beautiful views on this trail.

Crane Mountain - Hard to find, but this rocky climb is worth the effort!

Roaring Brook Falls -

Shelving Rock Mountain -

Tongue Mountain -

46 High Peaks -
